provis.src

provis.src.data_handler module

class provis.src.data_handler.DataHandler(name)

Bases: object

The ‘brain’ of provis. This class loads information from a variety of files and creates meshes to be plotted. Upper level classes - eg. Surface - have their own DataHandler objects to do all the work.

get_atom_mesh(atom_data, vw=0, probe=0, phi_res=10, theta_res=10)

Create a list of Shperes and colors representing each atom for plotting. Can later be added to a mesh for plotting.

Parameters

  • name – atom_data - Dictionary of atoms and their coordinates, by atom type

  • type – dict

  • name – vw, optional - When set to True Van-der-Waals atomic radii used instead of empirical radii; default false

  • type – bool

  • name – probe - size of probe (representing the solvent size) needed for surface calculation

  • type – int

  • name – phi_res - pyvista phi_resolution for Sphere objects representing atoms

  • type – int

  • name – theta_res - pyvista theta_resolution for Sphere objects representing atoms

  • type – int

Returns

list - List of pyvista Shperes representing each atom

Returns

list - List of colors for each atom

get_atoms(show_solvent=False)

Creates a dictionary of atomic coordinates from structure

Parameters

  • name – show_solvent - If True solvent molecules also added to retrun dictionary

  • type – bool

Returns

dict - Dictionary of atomic coordinates by atom type

get_bond_mesh()

Determine bonds from 3D information

Returns

list - List of pyvista lines representing each bond

get_residue_info(res, chain, option)

Calculates information about specified residue from mol2 file

Parameters

  • name – res - Residue number of specified residue be looked at

  • type – str

  • name – chain - Chain number of corresponding to residue be looked at

  • name – option - choose what property of residue you want

  • type – str - com for Centre Of Mass, ch for charge

Returns

list - list of COM coords of given (exact) residue

get_residue_mesh(res_data, phi_res=25, theta_res=25)

Create a list of Shperes and colors representing each residue for plotting

Parameters

  • name – res_data - Dictionary of residues and their coordinates, by residue type

  • type – dict

  • name – phi_res - pyvista phi_resolution for Sphere objects representing atoms

  • type – int

  • name – theta_res - pyvista theta_resolution for Sphere objects representing atoms

  • type – int

Returns

list - List of pyvista Shperes representing each residue

Returns

list - List of colors for each residue

get_residues()

Creates a dictionary of coordinates by residues from structure object

Returns

dict - Dictionary of atomic coordinates by residue type

get_structure()

Return the loaded structure object

Returns

structure

load_forv(file_name, end, vorf)

Load surface information from face or vert file

Parameters

  • name – file_name - Name of input file

  • type – str

  • name – end - Type of input file

  • type – str

  • name – vorf - Vertex or face file. “v” for vertex, “f” for face

  • type – str

Returns

list - list of data

provis.src.file_converter module

class provis.src.file_converter.FileConverter(name=None, dens=None, solv=0, bash=None)

Bases: object

Class to create necessary files required in other parts of code.

static msms(name, dens)

Run the msms script for given filename and density Works on both linux and windows (could easily be extended with other parameters)

Parameters

  • name – name - Name of file

  • type – str

  • name – dens - Density of triangulation

  • type – float

Returns

void - face and vert files

static pdb_to_mol2(name)

Run openbabel, to convert pdb to mol2

Parameters

  • name – name - name of file (without extension)

  • type – str

static pdb_to_xyzr(name, solvent, bash=0)

Run the pdb_to_xyzr script for given filename

Parameters

  • name – name - Name of file

  • type – str

  • name – bash - set to True if you want to run binary version of pdb_to_xyzr (comes with msms). Default: false

  • type – bool

Returns

void - xyzr file

provis.src.residue module

class provis.src.residue.Residue(id=None, chain=0, padding=0)

Bases: object

Residue class is mainly used for plotting a bounding box around the given residue.

add_residue(id, chain=0)

Add a new residue to the internal list

Parameters

  • name – id - id of residue

  • type – int

  • name – chain - chain id of residue

  • type – int

Returns

list - list of the current residues

get_res_info()

Returns all internal information of class

Returns

list - list of the current residues

Returns

int - padding for bounding box

provis.src.stick_point module

class provis.src.stick_point.StickPoint(name)

Bases: object

The StickPoint class is used to visualize the structural information of the given molecule. One can easily plot the atoms, residues, bonds or any combination of these.

manual_plot(atoms=0, col_a=0, box=0, bonds=0, vw=0, residues=0, col_r=0, res=0, outname=0)

Plot stick and point model

Parameters

  • name – atoms - List of pyvista Shperes representing each atom, default 0

  • type – list

  • name – col_a - List of colors for each atom, default 0

  • type – list

  • name – box - If True bounding box also visualized, default 0

  • type – bool

  • name – bonds - List of pyvista Lines representing each bond, default 0

  • type – list

  • name – vw - If True styling for Van-der-Waals plotting set. Vw atomic objects still have to be passed under ‘atoms’ variable

  • name – res - List of pyvista Shperes representing each residue, default 0

  • type – list

  • name – col_r - List of colors for each residue, default 0

  • type – list

  • name – res - specified residues will be plotted with a bounding box around them

  • type – Residue

  • name – outname - save image of plot to specified filename. Will appear in data/output directory. default: data/output/{self._name}_stick_point

  • type – string

Returns

void - Window with interactive plot

plot(atoms=0, box=0, bonds=0, vw=0, residues=0, res=0, outname=0)

Plot stick and point model

Parameters

  • name – atoms - Plot atoms, default 0

  • type – bool

  • name – box, optional - If True bounding box also visualized, default 0

  • type – bool

  • name – bonds, optional - Plot bond, default 0

  • type – bool

  • name – vw - Plot Wan-der-Waals radii instead of atomic radii

  • type – bool

  • name – residues, optional - Plot residue, default 0

  • type – bool

  • name – res - specified residues will be plotted with a bounding box around them

  • type – Residue

  • name – outname - save image of plot to specified filename. Will appear in data/output directory

  • type – string

Returns

void - Window with interactive plot

plot_atoms(box=0, r=0, outname=0)

Plot stick and point model

Parameters

  • name – box, optional - If True bounding box also visualized, default 0

  • type – bool

  • name – res - specified residues will be plotted with a bounding box around them

  • type – Residue

  • name – outname - save image of plot to specified filename. Will appear in data/output directory

  • type – string

plot_bonds(box=0, r=0, outname=0)

Plot bonds only

Parameters

  • name – box, optional - If True bounding box also visualized, default 0

  • type – bool

  • name – res - specified residues will be plotted with a bounding box around them

  • type – Residue

  • name – outname - save image of plot to specified filename. Will appear in data/output directory

  • type – string

plot_stick_point(box=0, r=0, outname=0)

Plot stick and point model

Parameters

  • name – box, optional - If True bounding box also visualized, default 0

  • type – bool

  • name – res - specified residues will be plotted with a bounding box around them

  • type – Residue

  • name – outname - save image of plot to specified filename. Will appear in data/output directory

  • type – string

plot_vw(box=0, r=0)

Plot Van-der-Waals atoms

Parameters

  • name – box, optional - If True bounding box also visualized, default 0

  • type – bool

  • name – res - specified residues will be plotted with a bounding box around them

  • type – Residue

  • name – outname - save image of plot to specified filename. Will appear in data/output directory

  • type – string

provis.src.surface module

class provis.src.surface.Surface(name)

Bases: object

The Surface class is used to visualize the surface information of the given molecule.

load_fv(file_name)

Load surface information from both face and vert files

Parameters

  • name – file_name - Name of input files

  • type – str

Returns

list - list of face data

Returns

list - list of vert data

plot_msms_surface(dens=0, outname=0)

Plot surface from face and vert files

Parameters

  • name – dens - sampling density used in msms binary. Needed to load the face and vert files, as their names include the density

  • name – outname - save image of plot to specified filename. Will appear in data/output/ directory. default: data/output/{self._name}_surface

  • type – string

Returns

void - plot

plot_surface(outname=0)

Plot surface natively, without binaries.

Parameters

  • name – outname - save image of plot to specified filename. Will appear in data/output/ directory. default: data/output/{self._name}_surface

  • type – string

Returns

plot
